pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:0.2: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:0.4: The sub-chapter on the dark of the night
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:0.5: 15. The training rule on departing without taking leave
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:1.2: At that time a certain nun was associating with a family from which she received a regular meal.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:1.3: Then, after robing up one morning, she took her bowl and robe and went to that family, where she sat down on a seat. She then departed without taking leave of the owners.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:1.4: Soon afterwards, a slave-woman who was sweeping the house put that seat in between some vessels.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:1.5: Not seeing the seat, the people there asked that nun,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:1.8: “Give back the seat, Venerable.” And after scolding her, they made an end of her regular meal.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:1.9: Then, while those people were cleaning the house, they saw that seat in between those vessels. They asked that nun for forgiveness and restored her regular meal.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:1.10: That nun then told the nuns what had happened.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:1.11: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:1.12: “How can a nun visit a family before the meal, sit down on a seat, and then depart without taking leave of the owners?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:1.13: “Is it true, monks, that a nun did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:1.16: “… How can a nun act like this?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:1.17: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:1.18: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:1.19.1: ‘If a nun visits families before the meal, sits down on a seat, and then departs without taking leave of the owners, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:2.1.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:2.1.8: there are four kinds of family: the aristocratic family, the brahmin family, the merchant family, the worker family.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:2.1.12: a place for sitting cross-legged is what is meant.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:2.1.15: Departs without taking leave of the owners:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:2.1.16: if, without taking leave of a person who understands in that family, she goes beyond the roof cover of that house, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:2.1.17: If it is out in the open and she goes beyond the vicinity of the seat, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:2.2.1: If she has not taken leave, and she does not perceive that she has, and she departs, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:2.2.2: If she has not taken leave, but she is unsure of it, and she departs, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:2.2.3: If she has not taken leave, but she perceives that she has, and she departs, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:2.2.4: If it is not a place for sitting cross-legged, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:2.2.5: If she has taken leave, but she does not perceive that she has, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:2.2.6: If she has taken leave, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:2.2.7: If she has taken leave, and she perceives that she has, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:2.3.2: if she departs after taking leave;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:2.3.3: if the seat is not movable;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:2.3.7: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc15:2.3.8: The fifth training rule is finished.
